text: Conospermum brownii, commonly known as blue-eyed smokebush, is a shrub endemic to Western Australia. The non-lignotuberous shrub typically grows to a height of . It blooms between August and December producing blue-white flowers. It is found in the Wheatbelt and Goldfields-Esperance regions of Western Australia where it grows in sandy soils often over laterite. ==References== ==External links== brownii Category:Endemic flora of Western Australia Category:Eudicots of Western Australia Category:Plants described in 1848 Category:Taxa named by Carl Meissner
title: Conospermum brownii
